importantDates.descriptionOfWhyDateIsRelevant: The date of the article's publication indicates the current state of the 2025 ALCS, marking a pivotal moment in the postseason baseball season.
Six days prior to the game, the Mariners scored five runs in four innings against Yesavage in Game 2, highlighting a turning point in the series that foreshadowed their struggles in later games.

importantTimeframes.descriptionOfWhyTimeFrameIsRelevant: The six-day span between the two games demonstrates a critical period during which the Mariners' performance declined, contributing to the momentum shift in favor of the Blue Jays.

keyTakeAways: Vladimir Guerrero Jr. hit six home runs in the postseason, including a decisive solo shot in the fifth inning, extending Toronto's lead to 5-0.
The Seattle Mariners committed three errors in the second inning, two of which were consecutive, leading to early runs and a significant breakdown in fielding.
The Blue Jays forced a Game 7 in the ALCS after a 6-2 victory, marking their first such game since 1985 and the second in franchise history.
Seattle has never previously played a Game 7 in its playoff history, making this a historic moment for the team.
The winner of the ALCS will face the Los Angeles Dodgers in the World Series, with Game 1 scheduled for Friday.
Yesavage, the 2024 first-round draft pick, pitched effectively with 31 splitters, seven strikeouts, and only six hits and three walks, showing composure under pressure.
The Blue Jays’ victory was amplified by defensive errors and a resilient offensive performance, particularly from Guerrero Jr. and Barger.

summaryOfNewsArticle: In a pivotal 2025 postseason matchup, the Toronto Blue Jays defeated the Seattle Mariners 6-2 to force a Game 7 in the American League Championship Series (ALCS). Vladimir Guerrero Jr. hit his sixth home run of the playoffs, including a solo shot in the fifth inning, while Seattle’s defensive lapses—such as two consecutive fielding errors in the second inning—led to early runs. The Mariners managed one run in the sixth via Josh Naylor’s homer and a single by Randy Arozerana, but a wild pitch from Matt Brash in the seventh allowed Guerrero to score and sealed the victory. The Blue Jays’ win marks their first Game 7 since 1985 and the second in franchise history, while the Mariners become the first team in their history to play a Game 7. The winner will face the Los Angeles Dodgers in the World Series.
title: Vladimir Guerrero Jr. hits sixth homer of postseason as Blue Jays dominate Mariners to force ALCS Game 7
